com.ontotext.s4.client

Class RestClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ontotext.s4.client.RestClient

  • public class RestClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Client responsible for communication with the S4 API. Handles authentication, and serialization and deserialization of JSON request and response bodies.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.net.URL DEFAULT_BASE_URL
      The standard base URI for the S4 API.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RestClient(java.lang.String apiKeyId, java.lang.String apiPassword)
      Create a client that uses the default base URL.
      RestClient(java.net.URL url, java.lang.String apiKeyId, java.lang.String apiPassword)
      Create a client using a specified base URL (for advanced use only - the default URL will work for all normal cases).

      • RestClient

        public RestClient(java.lang.String apiKeyId,
          java.lang.String apiPassword)
        Create a client that uses the default base URL.
        Parameters:
        apiKeyId - API key identifier for authentication
        apiPassword - API key password

      • RestClient

        public RestClient(java.net.URL url,
          java.lang.String apiKeyId,
          java.lang.String apiPassword)
        Create a client using a specified base URL (for advanced use only - the default URL will work for all normal cases).
        Parameters:
        url - API base URL
        apiKeyId - API key identifier for authentication
        apiPassword - API key password

    • Method Detail

      • getBaseUrl

        public java.net.URL getBaseUrl()

      • request

        public <T> T request(java.lang.String target,
            java.lang.String method,
            com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference<T> responseType,
            java.lang.Object requestBody,
            java.lang.String... extraHeaders)
          throws RestClientException
        Make an API request and parse the JSON response into a new object.
        Parameters:
        target - the URL to request (relative URLs will resolve against the base URL).
        method - the request method (GET, POST, DELETE, etc.)
        responseType - the Java type corresponding to a successful response message for this URL
        requestBody - the object that should be serialized to JSON as the request body. If null no request body is sent
        extraHeaders - any additional HTTP headers, specified as an alternating sequence of header names and values
        Returns:
        for a successful response, the deserialized response body, or null for a 201 response
        Throws:
        RestClientException - if an exception occurs during processing, or the server returns a 4xx or 5xx error response (in which case the response JSON message will be available as a JsonNode in the exception).

      • requestForStream

        public java.io.InputStream requestForStream(java.lang.String target,
                                   java.lang.String method,
                                   java.lang.Object requestBody,
                                   java.lang.String... extraHeaders)
                                     throws RestClientException
        Make an API request and return the raw data from the response as an InputStream.
        Parameters:
        target - the URL to request (relative URLs will resolve against the base URL).
        method - the request method (GET, POST, DELETE, etc.)
        requestBody - the object that should be serialized to JSON as the request body. If null no request body is sent
        extraHeaders - any additional HTTP headers, specified as an alternating sequence of header names and values
        Returns:
        for a successful response, the response stream, or null for a 201 response
        Throws:
        RestClientException - if an exception occurs during processing, or the server returns a 4xx or 5xx error response (in which case the response JSON message will be available as a JsonNode in the exception).

      • requestForUpdate

        public void requestForUpdate(java.lang.String target,
                    java.lang.String method,
                    java.lang.Object responseObject,
                    java.lang.Object requestBody,
                    java.lang.String... extraHeaders)
                      throws RestClientException
        Make an API request and parse the JSON response, using the response to update the state of an existing object.
        Parameters:
        target - the URL to request (relative URLs will resolve against the base URL).
        method - the request method (GET, POST, DELETE, etc.)
        responseObject - the Java object to update from a successful response message for this URL
        requestBody - the object that should be serialized to JSON as the request body. If null no request body is sent
        extraHeaders - any additional HTTP headers, specified as an alternating sequence of header names and values
        Throws:
        RestClientException - if an exception occurs during processing, or the server returns a 4xx or 5xx error response (in which case the response JSON message will be available as a JsonNode in the exception).

      • get

        public <T> T get(java.lang.String target,
        com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference<T> responseType)
      throws RestClientException
        Perform an HTTP GET request, parsing the JSON response to create a new object.
        Parameters:
        target - the URL to request (relative URLs will resolve against the base URL).
        responseType - the Java type corresponding to a successful response message for this URL
        Returns:
        for a successful response, the deserialized response body, or null for a 201 response
        Throws:
        RestClientException - if an exception occurs during processing, or the server returns a 4xx or 5xx error response (in which case the response JSON message will be available as a JsonNode in the exception).

      • post

        public <T> T post(java.lang.String target,
         com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference<T> responseType,
         java.lang.Object requestBody)
       throws RestClientException
        Perform an HTTP POST request, parsing the JSON response to create a new object.
        Parameters:
        target - the URL to request (relative URLs will resolve against the base URL).
        responseType - the Java type corresponding to a successful response message for this URL
        requestBody - the object that should be serialized to JSON as the request body. POST requests require a request body, so this parameter must not be null
        Returns:
        for a successful response, the deserialized response body, or null for a 201 response
        Throws:
        RestClientException - if an exception occurs during processing, or the server returns a 4xx or 5xx error response (in which case the response JSON message will be available as a JsonNode in the exception).

      • postForUpdate

        public void postForUpdate(java.lang.String target,
                 java.lang.Object responseObject,
                 java.lang.Object requestBody)
                   throws RestClientException
        Perform an HTTP POST request, parsing the JSON response to update the state of an existing object.
        Parameters:
        target - the URL to request (relative URLs will resolve against the base URL).
        responseObject - the Java object to update from a successful response message for this URL
        requestBody - the object that should be serialized to JSON as the request body. POST requests require a request body, so this parameter must not be null
        Throws:
        RestClientException - if an exception occurs during processing, or the server returns a 4xx or 5xx error response (in which case the response JSON message will be available as a JsonNode in the exception).

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String target)
            throws RestClientException
        Perform an HTTP DELETE request for the given resource.
        Parameters:
        target - the URL to request (relative URLs will resolve against the base URL).
        Throws:
        RestClientException - if an exception occurs during processing, or the server returns a 4xx or 5xx error response (in which case the response JSON message will be available as a JsonNode in the exception).

      • getRedirect

        public java.net.URL getRedirect(java.net.URL source)
                         throws RestClientException
        Perform an HTTP GET request on a URL whose response is expected to be a 3xx redirection, and return the target redirection URL.
        Parameters:
        source - the URL to request (relative URLs will resolve against the base URL).
        Returns:
        the URL returned by the "Location" header of the redirection response.
        Throws:
        RestClientException - if an exception occurs during processing, or the server returns a 4xx or 5xx error response (in which case the response JSON message will be available as a JsonNode in the exception), or if the response was not a 3xx redirection.
